name: Heart Aerospace
headline: Heart makes electric airplanes with an all-electric range of 250 miles
description:
Heart makes electric airplanes. We’re based in Sweden, and we’re developing a 19-passenger aircraft (EASA CS-23/FAA Part 23 certifiable). The plane will have an all-electric range of 250 miles and a backup generator for reserves and range extension. 

We have signed LOIs with Scandinavian Airlines SAS (the biggest airline in northern Europe), BRA and Wideroe for 86+ planes.

founders.name: Anders Forslund, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Founder and CEO of Heart Aerospace (YC W19). PhD in aerospace design. Lives in Gothenburg, Sweden.

generated_description:
### Heart Aerospace: Pioneering Electric Flight

Heart Aerospace is shaking up the aviation industry with its innovative approach to sustainable air travel. Founded in 2018 and hailing from Gothenburg, Sweden, the company is on a mission to electrify regional transportation by developing an all-electric aircraft designed to transport 19 passengers over a range of 250 miles.

#### The Product

At the heart of Heart Aerospace's vision is their flagship aircraft, the ES-30. This plane not only boasts a 250-mile electric range but also features a backup generator for extended flights, ensuring safety and reliability. The ES-30 is built to meet rigorous certification standards set by EASA and FAA, making it a serious contender in the future of aviation.

#### Market Demand

Heart Aerospace isn't just dreaming big; they're backing it up with impressive partnerships. They've secured Letters of Intent (LOIs) for 86+ planes from notable airlines, including Scandinavian Airlines SAS, BRA, and Wideroe. This indicates not only confidence in their technology but also a growing demand for eco-friendly aviation solutions, especially amid rising climate concerns.

#### Team and Backing

With a dedicated team of 130 employees, led by seasoned professionals including Group Partner Gustaf Alstromer, the company stands poised for rapid growth and innovation. They are part of Y Combinator's Batch W19, bringing with it a wealth of resources and support from one of the most prominent startup accelerators.

#### The Bigger Picture

Heart Aerospace is positioned as an essential player in the fight against climate change. Their planes promise zero CO2 emissions on short routes, drastically lower total operating costs, and the potential for new regional connectivity by utilizing smaller airports. They’re supported by a network of investors and partners that includes United Airlines, Air Canada, and Breakthrough Energy Ventures, underlining the credibility and excitement surrounding their mission.

In a world where climate impact is becoming increasingly critical, Heart Aerospace is not just building planes; they’re creating pathways to a sustainable future in flight. With exciting developments on the horizon, they are a company to watch as they lead us into a new chapter of aviation. 

For more information, check out their [website](http://www.heartaerospace.com).
